results.description: Premiership club Harlequins appoint former Wolves managing director Laurie Dalrymple as their new chief executive.
results.title: Harlequins: Laurie Dalrymple joins Premiership club as chief executive

thumbnail.altText: Laurie Dalrymple in the stands at Wolverhampton Wanderers

results.description: Harlequins and England centre Joe Marchant agrees a new contract and six-month loan to Super Rugby side Blues.
results.shortTitle: Marchant to make Super Rugby loan move
results.title: Joe Marchant: Harlequins centre agrees contract extension and loan

results.description: Jono Lance kicks 14 points to give Worcester a hard-fought 19-14 win over Harlequins at the Stoop.
results.title: Premiership: Jono Lance's 14 points help Worcester Warriors to victory over Harlequins

results.description: England scrum-half Danny Care says Saracens should have their trophies taken away from them over the salary cap scandal.
results.title: Saracens salary cap scandal: 'I don't think the trophies should stand' - Danny Care

results.description: Harlequins Women will play at Twickenham for the first time next month, when they take on Leinster Women as part of Big Game 12.
results.shortTitle: Harlequins Women to make Twickenham bow
results.title: Harlequins Women to make their Twickenham debut against Leinster

results.description: Saracens have put rugby union "in a dangerous place" after they were found to breach salary cap rules, says ex-England captain Chris Robshaw.
results.title: Saracens have 'put rugby union in a dangerous place', says ex-England captain Chris Robshaw

results.description: The new Wales coaching team, led by Wayne Pivac, has a tough act to follow after Warren Gatland's departure, says former British and Irish Lions prop Adam Jones.
results.title: Adam Jones: Warren Gatland 'changed my career, I owe him', says ex-Wales prop

results.description: Bath face Northampton, Gloucester take on Saracens and Worcester travel to Harlequins in the Premiership & Bedford v Newcastle in the Championship.
results.title: Saracens, Bath, Northampton Saints & Gloucester in action

results.description: Taqele Naiyaravoro and Teimana Harrison score braces of tries as Northampton Saints brush aside Harlequins at Franklin's Gardens.
results.title: Premiership: Northampton Saints brush aside Harlequins 40-15 for third straight win

results.description: England forward Shaunagh Brown says "putting more resources into urban areas" could increase diversity in women's rugby.
results.shortTitle: Brown wants more focus in 'urban areas'
results.title: Shaunagh Brown: England prop wants more resources put into 'urban areas'

results.description: Friday's action in the Premiership & Championship - listen to BBC Radio commentary.
results.title: Listen to Premiership & Championship commentaries live

results.description: Harlequins beat Bristol for their first Premiership win of the season in a game dominated by kicking at The Stoop.
results.shortTitle: Harlequins battle to win over Bristol
results.title: Premiership: Harlequins 22-17 Bristol Bears

results.description: Saturday's Premiership commentaries - follow coverage on BBC Radio 5 Live Sports Extra and local radio.
results.title: Listen: Saturday's Premiership commentaries

results.description: Exeter begin their Premiership campaign with a hard-fought win against Harlequins at Sandy Park.
results.shortTitle: Exeter edge past Quins in season opener
results.title: Premiership: Exeter Chiefs 22-19 Harlequins

thumbnail.altText: Jonny Hill scored Exeter's only try against Quins

results.description: Former England team-mates Chris Ashton and Danny Care relive their highlight of World Cup captain Owen Farrell's wedding.
results.shortTitle: 'My suit was ruined but they were the best tackles I've ever made!'
results.title: Chris Ashton and Danny Care relive their highlight of Owen Farrell's wedding

results.description: Despite having big names away at the World Cup, Saracens and Exeter lead the contenders as the Premiership season starts.
results.title: Premiership: Saracens & Exeter Chiefs lead contenders for 2019-20 crown

thumbnail.altText: Alex Goode with the Premiership Rugby trophy

results.description: Saracens prop Josh Ibuanokpe is banned for five weeks for "striking with the head" in his side's victory against Harlequins.
results.title: Josh Ibuanokpe: Saracens prop handed five-week suspension by RFU

results.description: Relive Saracens' opening-weekend loss to Northampton Saints as it happened, while Exeter, Saracens and Worcester all win.
results.shortTitle: Relive Saracens' opening-weekend loss to Saints
results.title: Premiership: Relive Saracens' opening-weekend loss to Saints as it happened

results.description: Pool winners Sale, Harlequins and Exeter are joined by best-placed runners-up Saracens in the Premiership Cup semi-finals.
results.shortTitle: Sale, Quins, Exeter & Sarries reach semis
results.title: Premiership Rugby Cup: Sale, Harlequins, Exeter & Saracens reach semi-finals

thumbnail.altText: Ben Spencer scores the second his two tries for Saracens against Harlequins

results.description: Harlequins and Saracens both maintain their winning runs to remain top of the Premier 15s table.
results.shortTitle: Quins and Saracens maintain winning run
results.title: Premier 15s: Harlequins and Saracens maintain winning run
